alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 2:40PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mineral County through 315 PM MDT... At 239 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Pagosa Springs, or 36 miles north of Dulce, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Mineral County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft
